definition: end of the road/final road/fig. dead end/impasse
tip/end/final stage/latter part/inessential detail/powder/dust/opera role of old man
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end

sentences.english: That financial risks diehard of many private enterprises is the main cause toward their dooms.
sentences.chinese: 财务隐患的积重难返是很多民营企业走向末路的主因。

sentences.english: The sailor who had lost everything by shipwreck said that he was thrown on his beam-ends .
sentences.chinese: 这位在海难中失去一切的水手说，他已经穷途末路了。

sentences.english: Manufacturing, once America’s greatest strength, seemed to be in terminal decline.
sentences.chinese: 曾经是美国最为强实力的制造业到了走到末路的衰败。

sentences.english: Manouchehr Takin, do you agree that the nuclear renaissance is at an end?
sentences.chinese: 你认为核工业复兴会穷途末路吗？

sentences.english: For once, they did not worry about deadlines and editors.
sentences.chinese: 他们初次可以不消为截稿日期和编纂而懊末路。

sentences.english: When qin day also, thanks to the end by shen Qiang pulled.
sentences.chinese: 这时秦天也末路了，幸而被沈蔷拉住了。

sentences.english: She actually for this unintentional mistakes and annoying.
sentences.chinese: 她竟为这种无意之中所犯地错而末路火。

sentences.english: It was the beginning of the end for Iron Mike.
sentences.chinese: 铁拳迈克的末路也由此开始。

sentences.english: This does not mean that ambition is at an end.
sentences.chinese: 这并不意味着雄心已到了穷途末路。

definition: lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
sunset, the end of the road (idiom); in terminal decline/at a dead end
fall (of an empire)
lit. on all sides, the songs of Chu (idiom)/fig. surrounded by enemies, isolated and without help
to be destroyed/to become extinct/to perish/to die out/to destroy/to exterminate
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
to decline/to die out/decline and fall
to be defeated and dispersed
to decline/to wane/to decay/to deteriorate
uninspired/dejected/discouraged
to decline/to wane
to diverge from the main road, also figuratively
one's declining years/old age
past one's prime
destruction
